meta.title: Table
meta.description: For displaying tabular data. <b-table> supports pagination, filtering, sorting, custom rendering, events, and asynchronous data. For simple display of tabular data without all the fancy features, BootstrapVue also provides lightweight alternative components <b-table-lite> and <b-table-simple>

props.description: Applies striping to the tbody rows
Adds borders to all the cells and headers
Removes all borders from cells
Adds an outline border to the table element
Places the table in dark mode
Enables hover styling on rows
Renders the table with smaller cell padding
Makes all columns equal width (fixed layout table). Will speed up rendering for large tables. Column widths can be set via CSS or colgroup
Makes the table responsive in width, adding a horizontal scrollbar. Set to true for always responsive or set to one of the breakpoints to switch from responsive to normal: 'sm', 'md', 'lg', 'xl'
Makes the table header sticky. Set to true for a maximum height 300px tall table, or set to any valid CSS hight (including units)
Disable's the collapsing of table borders. Useful when table has sticky headers or columns
Visually place the table caption above the table. Default is below.
Apply a Bootstrap theme color variant to the entire table
CSS class (or classes) to apply to the table element
Place the table in stacked mode. Set to true for always stacked, or set to one of the breakpoints to switch from stacked to normal: 'sm', 'md', 'lg', 'xl'
Header variant: 'light' or 'dark', or unset. May take precedence over head-row-variant
Apply a Bootstrap theme color variant to the tr element in the thead
Footer variant: 'light' or 'dark', or unset. May take precedence over foot-row-variant
Apply a Bootstrap theme color variant to the tr element in the tfoot. Falls back to head-row-variant
Vue 'transition-group' properties. When provided will make the tbody a Vue 'transition-group' component
Vue 'transition-group' event handlers. When provided will make the tbody a Vue 'transition-group' component
Text string to place in the caption element
HTML string to place in the caption element. Use with caution
CSS class (or classes) to apply to the thead element
CSS class (or classes) to apply to the tr element in the thead
Enable to the footer of the table, and clone the header content by default
CSS class (or classes) to apply to the tfoot element
CSS class (or classes) to apply to the tr element in the tfoot
CSS class (or classes) to apply to the tbody element
CSS class (or classes) to apply to the tr element in the tbody. Can be a function that returns a class (see docs for details)
Attributes to be added to each tr in the tbody, or a function returning such attributes (see docs for details)
CSS class (or classes) to apply to the td element in the details row
Currently displayed row data. Read-only. Do not set a value on this prop
Array of field names or array of field definition objects
Array of items to display, or an items provider function reference. Refer to the docs for details
Name of a table field that contains a guaranteed unique value per row. Needed for tbody transition support, and also speeds up table rendering
When set, forces the table into the busy state.Automatically set when an items provider function is being called
When set, uses internal paging to pagination the data. Otherwise the items provider is expected to perform the paging
When set, uses internal sorting to sort the data. Otherwise the items provider is expected to perform the sorting
When set, uses internal filtering to pagination the data. Otherwise the provider is expected to perform the filtering
Pass through prop. Passed as part of the context object sent to the items provider function
Number of rows to show per page. Set to 0 to disable pagination
The current page number to display when the table is paginated. Starting from 1 and up
Disabled the internal sorting routine, and expects the user to provde the items sorted. Sorting controls will still be available
When the build in formatter is used, setting this prop will disable the sorting ability in the footer
Positions the sort control to the left of the header text. Default is on the right of the header text
When a table is sortable, clicking on any non-sortable column heading will clear the current sort values. Set this prop to disable this feature
When sorting, null and undefined values will be sorted first (or last, depending on 'sort-desc'). Set this prop to sort null values last. Only applicable to internal sorting
Field name that is currently being sorted. Set to null to clear sorting. Syncable with the .sync prop modifier
Set to true to sort the column in descending order. Syncable with the .sync prop modifier
The initial sorting direction to sort an unsorted column by: 'asc', 'desc', or 'last' (to use the previous sort direction)
A reference to a function for sort-comparing two rows of data. Defaults to the internal sort compare routine. See docs for details
An object containing sort configuration for the 'String.prototype.sortLocale' method. See docs for details
The locale string (or array of locale string) that specified the language when sorting. See docs for details
Hidden string to place in the header cell when clicking the cell will change the sort direction to ascending
Hidden string to place in the header cell when clicking the cell will change the sort direction to descending
Hidden string to place in the header cell when clicking the cell will clear the current sorting direction
When set, places the table body rows in selectable mode
The selectable mode for the table when 'selectable' is set. Possible values: 'single', 'multi' or 'range'

Bootstrap color theme variant to set selected rows to. Use any of the standard Bootstrap theme color variants, or the special table row variant 'active' (default). Set to an empty string to not use a variant
Disables row selection via click events. Row selection will be only available programmatically
When enabled, and there are no item records to show, shows a message that there are no rows to show
Text string to show when the table has no items to show
HTML string to show when the table has no items to show. Use with caution
Text string to show when the table has no items to show due to filtering
HTML string to show when the table has no items to show due to filtering. Use with caution
Criteria for filtering. Internal filtering supports only string or RegExpr criteria.
Reference to a function to use instead of the internal filtering function. Refer to the docs for details
Array of top level fields to ignore when filtering the item data
Array of fields to include when filtering. Overrides filter-ignore-fields
Time in milliseconds to debounce changes to the filter criteria before filtering the records

events.description: Emitted when a row is clicked.

args.description: Item data of the row being clicked.
Index of the row being clicked.
Native event object.

events.description: Emitted when a row is double clicked.

args.description: Item data of the row being double clicked.
Index of the row being double clicked.
Native event object.

events.description: Emitted when a row is middle clicked.

args.description: Item data of the row being middle clicked.
Index of the row being middle clicked.
Native event object.

events.description: Emitted when a row is right clicked.

args.description: Item data of the row being right clicked.
Index of the row being right clicked.
Native event object.

events.description: Emitted when a row is hovered.

args.description: Item data of the row being hovered.
Index of the row being hovered.
Native event object.

events.description: Emitted when a row is unhovered.

args.description: Item data of the row being unhovered.
Index of the row being unhovered.
Native event object.

events.description: Emitted when a row or rows have been selected or unselected.

args.description: Array of the row items that are selected.

events.description: Emitted when a header or footer cell is clicked. Not applicable for 'custom-foot' slot.

args.description: Column key clicked (field name).
Field definition object.
Native event object.
'True' if this event originated from clicking on the footer cell

events.description: Emitted when the sorting on the table has changed

args.description: Table state context object. See docs.

events.description: Emitted whenever the table state context has changed

args.description: Table state context object. See docs.

events.description: Emitted when local filtering causes a change in the number of items.

args.description: Array of items after filtering (before local pagination occurs).

events.description: Emitted when the items provider function has returned data.

rootEventListeners.description: Refresh data of a specific table when this event is emitted on $root

args.description: table id to refresh data

slots.name: cell({key})
slots.description: Scoped slot for custom data rendering of field data. '{key}' is the field's key name. See docs for scoped data

scope.description: The row's index (zero-based) with respect to the displayed rows
The row's item data object
The value for this key in the record (null or undefined if a virtual column), or the output of the field's formatter function
The raw value for this key in the item record (null or undefined if a virtual column), before being passed to the field's formatter function
The field's normalized definition object (from the fields prop)
Will be true if the row's row-details scoped slot is visible
Can be called to toggle the visibility of the rows row-details scoped slot
Will be true if the row has been selected. Only applicable when table is in selectable mode
Can be called to select the current row. Only applicable when table is in selectable mode
Can be called to unselect the current row. Only applicable when table is in selectable mode

slots.name: cell()
slots.description: Default scoped slot for custom data rendering of field data. See docs for scoped data

scope.description: The row's index (zero-based) with respect to the displayed rows
The row's item data object
The value for this key in the record (null or undefined if a virtual column), or the output of the field's formatter function
The raw value for this key in the item record (null or undefined if a virtual column), before being passed to the field's formatter function
The field's normalized definition object (from the fields prop)
Will be true if the row's row-details scoped slot is visible
Can be called to toggle the visibility of the rows row-details scoped slot
Will be true if the row has been selected. Only applicable when table is in selectable mode
Can be called to select the current row. Only applicable when table is in selectable mode
Can be called to unselect the current row. Only applicable when table is in selectable mode

slots.name: head({key})
slots.description: Scoped slot for custom rendering of field header. '{key}' is the field's key name. See docs for scoped header

scope.description: The field's key value
The field's normalized definition object (from the fields prop)
The field's label value
Select all rows (applicable if the table is in selectable mode)
Unselect all rows (applicable if the table is in selectable mode)
Will be true if the slot is being rendered in the table footer

slots.name: head()
slots.description: Default scoped slot for custom rendering of field header. See docs for scoped header

scope.description: The field's key value
The field's normalized definition object (from the fields prop)
The field's label value
Select all rows (applicable if the table is in selectable mode)
Unselect all rows (applicable if the table is in selectable mode)
Will be true if the slot is being rendered in the table footer

slots.name: foot({key})
slots.description: Scoped slot for custom rendering of field footer. '{key}' is the field's key name. See docs for scoped footer

scope.description: The field's key value
The field's normalized definition object (from the fields prop)
The field's label value
Select all rows (applicable if the table is in selectable mode)
Unselect all rows (applicable if the table is in selectable mode)

slots.name: foot()
slots.description: Default scoped slot for custom rendering of field footer. See docs for scoped footer

scope.description: The field's key value
The field's normalized definition object (from the fields prop)
The field's label value
Select all rows (applicable if the table is in selectable mode)
Unselect all rows (applicable if the table is in selectable mode)

slots.name: table-caption
slots.description: Content to display in the table's caption element

slots.name: table-colgroup
slots.description: Slot to place custom colgroup and col elements. Optionally scoped

scope.description: The number of columns in the table
Array of field definition objects

slots.name: table-busy
slots.description: Optional slot to place loading message when table is in the busy state

slots.name: row-details
slots.description: Scoped slot for optional rendering additional record details. See docs for Row details support

scope.description: The entire row's record data object
The item's row index number (with respect to the displayed item rows)
The normalized fields definition array (in the array of objects format)
Function to toggle visibility of the row's details slot
Will be true if the row has been selected. Only applicable when table is in selectable mode
Can be called to select the current row. Only applicable when table is in selectable mode
Can be called to unselect the current row. Only applicable when table is in selectable mode

slots.name: empty
slots.description: Content to display when no items are present in the `items` array. Optionally scoped

scope.description: The normalized fields definition array (in the array of objects format)
The items array. Exposed here to check null vs []
The value of the empty-text prop
The value of the empty-html prop
The value of the empty-filtered-text prop
The value of the empty-filtered-html prop

slots.name: emptyfiltered
slots.description: Content to display when no items are present in the filtered `items` array. Optionally scoped

scope.description: The normalized fields definition array (in the array of objects format)
The items array. Exposed here to check null vs []
The value of the empty-text prop
The value of the empty-html prop
The value of the empty-filtered-text prop
The value of the empty-filtered-html prop

slots.name: thead-top
slots.description: Slot above the column headers in the `thead` element for user-supplied B-TR's with B-TH/B-TD. Optionally scoped.

scope.description: The number of columns in the table
The normalized fields definition array (in the array of objects format)
Select all rows (applicable if the table is in selectable mode)
Unselect all rows (applicable if the table is in selectable mode)

slots.name: top-row
slots.description: Fixed top row slot for user supplied B-TD cells. Optionally scoped

scope.description: The number of columns in the table
The normalized fields definition array (in the array of objects format)

slots.name: bottom-row
slots.description: Fixed bottom row slot for user supplied B-TD cells. Optionally Scoped

scope.description: The number of columns in the table
The normalized fields definition array (in the array of objects format)

slots.name: custom-foot
slots.description: Custom footer content slot for user supplied B-TR, B-TH, B-TD. Optionally Scoped

scope.description: The number of columns in the table
The normalized fields definition array (in the array of objects format)
Array of items that are currently being displayed

props.description: Applies striping to the tbody rows
Adds borders to all the cells and headers
Removes all borders from cells
Adds an outline border to the table element
Places the table in dark mode
Enables hover styling on rows
Renders the table with smaller cell padding
Makes all columns equal width (fixed layout table). Will speed up rendering for large tables. Column widths can be set via CSS or colgroup
Makes the table responsive in width, adding a horizontal scrollbar. Set to true for always responsive or set to one of the breakpoints to switch from responsive to normal: 'sm', 'md', 'lg', 'xl'
Makes the table header sticky. Set to true for a maximum height 300px tall table, or set to any valid CSS hight (including units)
Disable's the collapsing of table borders. Useful when table has sticky headers or columns
Visually place the table caption above the table. Default is below.
Apply a Bootstrap theme color variant to the entire table
CSS class (or classes) to apply to the table element
Place the table in stacked mode. Set to true for always stacked, or set to one of the breakpoints to switch from stacked to normal: 'sm', 'md', 'lg', 'xl'
Vue 'transition-group' properties. When provided will make the tbody a Vue 'transition-group' component
Vue 'transition-group' event handlers. When provided will make the tbody a Vue 'transition-group' component
Header variant: 'light' or 'dark', or unset
Footer variant: 'light' or 'dark', or unset
Number of columns this cell spans
Number of rows this cell spans
Heading for the cell when in stacked mode. Only applicable to cells in the 'tbody' element
If this will be a sticky colum. Must be set on all cells in this column. table must be in sticky-header or responsive mode to work
Number of columns this cell spans
